the evidence presented before: conclusion I can reach is that the learned President has not arrived at a finding that
is  contrary  or  perverse  to  the  evidence  presented  before  the  Tribunal  by  the
Appellant.   In  my view, the learned  Judge  of the High Court has also correctly
arrived at the finding that the learned President of the Labour Tribunal has based
all his findings on the evidence placed before him.
